message:
That depends on what you are willing to call "parallel". For clarity, I always use the term "parallel" to mean multithreading. Otherwise (IMO) the term becomes too diluted to be useful.

With a broader definition of "parallel", you could say multithreading is parallel, and asynchrony is parallel, and CPUs are parallel with hard drives, and one computer is parallel with another computer across the Internet (in the case of an HTTP call). But I find the tighter definition much more useful.
